page.title: 14MOTTRAM - Ecology
page.content: In the past the creation of woodland and its maintenance, the planting of hedges and hedgerow trees, was mainly in the hands of local landowners or enlightened farmers. However, since the changes in land ownership and the desire for high returns on expensive land such improvements have been in the hands of County Councils, Local Authorities or Societies. In Mottram activity of this kind has been taken on by the local amenity society, who, under the supervision of its countryside officer were instrumental in creating, with the help of some local residents and school children , a number of small woods and plantations, the largest one being Jubilee Wood.
